On 6/29/06, berndq <berndq@...> wrote:
>
>
> Hi all,
>
> I can see that=
 this is nicer than a try/fail/catch construct.
>
> But what if the same ex=
ception type is thrown from another place
> than the expected one (inside t=
he same test method)? Can't we have false
> positives then?


Yes.  If this=
 might happen, you can either fall back to the try/catch
approach or break =
your test down further (if your test method invokes
another method, see if =
you can test that other method in a different test).
